trans-unit.source: Describes the first steps you can take to get started with Azure Mobile Services in a Cordova project
trans-unit.target: Describes the first steps you can take to get started with Azure Mobile Services in a Cordova project

trans-unit.source: The first step you need to do in order to follow the code in these examples depends on what type of mobile service you connected to.
trans-unit.target: The first step you need to do in order to follow the code in these examples depends on what type of mobile service you connected to.

trans-unit.source: For a JavaScript backend mobile service, create a table called TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: For a JavaScript backend mobile service, create a table called TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: To create a table, locate the mobile service under the Azure node in Server Explorer, right-click the mobile service's node to open the context menu, and choose Create Table.
trans-unit.target: To create a table, locate the mobile service under the Azure node in Server Explorer, right-click the mobile service's node to open the context menu, and choose Create Table.

trans-unit.source: Enter "TodoItem" as the table name.
trans-unit.target: Enter "TodoItem" as the table name.

trans-unit.source: If you have a .NET backend mobile service, there's already a TodoItem table in the default project template that Visual Studio created for you, but you need to publish it to Azure.
trans-unit.target: If you have a .NET backend mobile service, there's already a TodoItem table in the default project template that Visual Studio created for you, but you need to publish it to Azure.

trans-unit.source: To publish it, open the context menu for the mobile service project in Solution Explorer, and choose Publish Web.
trans-unit.target: To publish it, open the context menu for the mobile service project in Solution Explorer, and choose Publish Web.

trans-unit.source: Accept the defaults, and choose the Publish button.
trans-unit.target: Accept the defaults, and choose the Publish button.

trans-unit.source: The following code gets a reference to a table that contains data for a TodoItem, which you can use in subsequent operations to read and update the data table.
trans-unit.target: The following code gets a reference to a table that contains data for a TodoItem, which you can use in subsequent operations to read and update the data table.

trans-unit.source: The TodoItem table is created automatically when you create a mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The TodoItem table is created automatically when you create a mobile service.

trans-unit.source: For these examples to work, permissions on the table must be set to Anybody with an Application Key.
trans-unit.target: For these examples to work, permissions on the table must be set to Anybody with an Application Key.

trans-unit.source: Later, you can set up authentication.
trans-unit.target: Later, you can set up authentication.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get started with authentication</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get started with authentication</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Insert a new item into a data table.
trans-unit.target: Insert a new item into a data table.

trans-unit.source: An id (a GUID of type string) is automatically created as the primary key for the new row.
trans-unit.target: An id (a GUID of type string) is automatically created as the primary key for the new row.

trans-unit.source: Call the done method on the returned Promise object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.
trans-unit.target: Call the done method on the returned Promise object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.

trans-unit.source: The following code queries a table for all items, sorted by the text field.
trans-unit.target: The following code queries a table for all items, sorted by the text field.

trans-unit.source: You can add code to process the query results in the success handler.
trans-unit.target: You can add code to process the query results in the success handler.

trans-unit.source: In this case, a local array of the items is updated.
trans-unit.target: In this case, a local array of the items is updated.

trans-unit.source: You can use the where method to modify the query.
trans-unit.target: You can use the where method to modify the query.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example that filters out completed items.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example that filters out completed items.

trans-unit.source: For more examples of queries you can use, see [query]((http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj613353.aspx)) object.
trans-unit.target: For more examples of queries you can use, see [query]((http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj613353.aspx)) object.

trans-unit.source: Update a row in a data table.
trans-unit.target: Update a row in a data table.

trans-unit.source: In this code, when the mobile service responds, the item is removed from the list.
trans-unit.target: In this code, when the mobile service responds, the item is removed from the list.

trans-unit.source: Call the done method on the returned Promise object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.
trans-unit.target: Call the done method on the returned Promise object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.

trans-unit.source: Delete a row in a data table using the del method.
trans-unit.target: Delete a row in a data table using the del method.

trans-unit.source: Call the done method on the returned Promise object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.
trans-unit.target: Call the done method on the returned Promise object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about mobile services</linkText><title></title>
